msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4171

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides; almost regularly cut at the top. The papyrus is broken and the column has some lacunae as a result of vertical folds: at the beginning, at the middle, at the end of lines and after the payments. There is a big lacuna is in the middle of the column to the left hand side, and several small holes throughout. No restoration is needed.

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated the new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the taxpayer.

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Petaus, son of Esouris, grandson of Petheus, mother Tkollauthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 208)
Castrensis, slave of Thaisarion, alias Nebsosis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)

Didymos, son of Satabous, grandson of Pakysis, mother Tanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 162)
Ninis, son of Asklas, grandson of Ninis, mother Tabous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Eutyches, slave of Sarapias (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 165)

Ptolemaios, son of Agathos Daimon, grandson of Petheus, mother Stiunchis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 216)

Sisois, son of Naaraus (second), grandson of Theabennis, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 229)
Petheus, son of Pasoxis, grandson of Petheus, mother Segathis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 203)
Aphrodisios, son of Onnophris, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Ptolema (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 157)
Mysthes, son of Phaesis, grandson of Mysthes, mother Aunchis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 189)
Heron, son of Pekmeis, also called Heuremon, mother Sambathion (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Sabinus, son of Pasoknopaios, grandson of Horos, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 222)
[. . . . . Onno]phris, grandson of Horos, mother Herais (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Herakleides, son of Abykis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 167)
Petheus, son of Petheus, grandson of Onnophris, mother Taphaseis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 203)
Tasoucharion, daughter of Sokrates, (son of Petalion) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 239)

Heron, son of Onnophris, grandson of Theabennis, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 171)
Petheus, son of Sokmenis, grandson of Sokmenis, mother Thaesis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 204)
Petheus, son of Heron, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Eserempis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 201)
Petheus, son of Phanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 204)
Kastor, son of Petheus, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Herakleia (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 181)
Tiberius Klaus Kreskas through Leouas Petheus shield bearer (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 242)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: �ǣ(Column). 117;Petaus, son of Esouris, grandson of Petheus, mother Tkollauthis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Castrensis, slave of Thaisarion, alias Nebsosis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas, 28 obols, the remaining the administrator fee;;Sarapion, son of Phasis, grandson of Keras, mother Helene, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Didymos, son of Satabous, grandson of Pakysis, mother Tanomgeus, the administrator fee 4 drachmas the remaining the administrator fee;;Ninis, son of Asklas, grandson of Ninis, mother Tabous, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Eutyches, slave of Sarapias, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Petaus, son of Herieus, grandson of Petaus, mother Tremenesis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Ptolemaios, son of Agathos Daimon, grandson of Petheus, mother Stiunchis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Sambas, son of Peteesis, grandson of Apollonios, mother Tanomgeus, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Herieus, the son, mother Tapapeis, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Ptolemaios, son of Psenesis, grandson of Onnophris, mother Thermouthis, 4 drachmas;;Sisois, son of Naaraus (second), grandson of Theabennis, mother Thaisas, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;The total for the day;;The 29th of the same (month);;Petheus, son of Pasoxis, grandson of Petheus, mother Segathis, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Aphrodisios, son of Onnophris, grandson of Pnepheros, mother Ptolema, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Mysthes, son of Phaesis, grandson of Mysthes, mother Aunchis, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Heron, son of Pekmeis, also called Heuremon, mother Sambathion, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Sabinus, son of Pasoknopaios, grandson of Horos, mother Tapetheus, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;[. . . . . sheaves for the 13th year of the property of Maikenatiane, 7 dirty drachmas, 3 obols;;Petheus, son of Petheus, grandson of Onnophris, mother Taphaseis, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Tasoucharion,
